name: Queen SƒÅlote Tupou III
description: Beloved Queen of Tonga who modernized the kingdom while preserving Tongan culture and gained international recognition for her dignity and grace
philosophy: A nation's strength lies not in its weapons or wealth, but in the character of its people and the wisdom of its traditions. Progress must honor the past.
contributions: Established Tonga's first government high school
International symbol of Pacific dignity (Queen Elizabeth II's coronation)
quotes: The old must give way to the new, but not at the expense of what makes us who we are.
A leader must be like the coconut tree - bend with the wind, but never break.
